alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Nemaha; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 12 at 9:26PM CDT until April 12 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Nemaha County in northeastern Kansas... Southeastern Washington County in north central Kansas... Marshall County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 926 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Summerfield to 5 miles south of Blue Rapids, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Marysville, Seneca, Blue Rapids, Frankfort, Waterville, Axtell, Beattie, Summerfield, Vermillion, Oketo, Baileyville and Lillis. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
